Identity.History: In Winter, the arctic fox’s white coat is one of the warmest fur of any animal on the planet. Come Summer, their coats change to a gray-brown color. The Arctic fox’s length ranges from 20 to 30 inches not counting their tail. That gives them an extra 10 to 17 inches. Arctic foxes dig complex burrow systems for shelter and child-rearing, and they are shared by many mating pairs over many generations.
